title: What is the importance of multilingual education in children? - Quora

response.answer_text: Researchers have shown that additional languages help children in their cognitive development at the same time that it brings personal and social gains. Some cognitive tested gains are creativity, problem-solving skills, improved meta-linguistic ability, and bigger sensitivity to comprehending the needs of other people, among others. There are also societal gains: economic gains, as a multilingual workforce is good for economic competitiveness, and cultural gains, tolerance to other cultures and peoples. It exposes the children to a variety of language possibilities that allow them to function in different settings and contexts. They also find it easier to learn other languages in adulthood.

Importance? Best things in life are free… but not to multilingual nerds.Consequences. It usually is an advantage but I would say, do not push it much. In the grand scheme of life there may be a trade off between say habits of physical and mental activity = lean body vs. IQ. An early formal education can be quite stressful which will produce multilingual but perhaps a bit touchy, unpleasant adults [early stresses shift the hormonal levels]. Same with the puzzling 3lingual immersion: .. some kids are not predisposed for immersion too well and 3 tongues puzzle them so they react by excluding 1 or 2 from their active repertoire.
